alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Scott; Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 3:49PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jasper, Smith and southeastern Scott Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 349 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near White Oak to 7 miles east of Mount Olive. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pulaski around 405 PM CDT. Center Ridge around 410 PM CDT. Morton around 415 PM CDT. Raleigh around 420 PM CDT. Burns, Pineville and Homewood around 430 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Sylvarena, Polkville, Mize, Montrose and Louin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
